citation.article-title: Shinella fusca sp. nov., isolated from domestic waste compost
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Shinella fusca sp. nov.
Shinella fusca (fus′ca. L. fem. adj. fusca dark, that produces dark colonies).
Colonies are pale brown on PCA medium after 3 days of incubation.
Cells are Gram-negative, motile, short rods (1.19±0.19 μm long and 0.45±0.09 μm wide; ±sd, n=30).
Cell aggregates are observed micro- and macroscopically and at later stages of growth in broth cultivation media.
Growth occurs at 10–40 °C, pH 6–9 and in the presence of 0–3 % NaCl.
Nitrate is reduced and supports anaerobic growth. nifH genes are not detected by PCR and nitrogen fixation is not observed.

Aesculin is hydrolysed, urease activity is slow and the enzymes acid- and alkaline phosphatases, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, trypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase are produced.

The sole carbon sources d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, maltose, potassium gluconate, glycerol, d-ribose, d-xylose, adonitol, d-galactose, l-rhamnose, inositol, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, cellobiose, sucrose, trehalose, xylitol, d-lyxose and l-fucose are assimilated.
Adipate, citrate and d-arabitol are weakly assimilated.
Growth occurs in the presence of sulfamethoxazole (25 μg).
The predominant fatty acid is C18 : 1 (ω7c/12t/9t) and the major respiratory quinone is ubiquinone 10.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 66.2±0.1 mol%.
The type strain, DC-196T (=CCUG 55808T=LMG 24714T), was isolated from domestic waste compost.
The 16S rRNA gene sequence similarity between strain DC-196T and the type strain of the type species of the genus (S. granuli, CCUG 56487T) is 97.6 %.
